intro: Acnistus loxensis, commonly known as the hairy acnistus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the wet season. Acnistus loxensis is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
